The majority of champions in the game work off of BONUS AD ratios.
Talon uses BONUS AD ratios. 5.7  
Zed uses BONUS AD ratios.  something something 3.5 AD
Pantheon uses BONUS AD ratios. 4.4 AD
Rengar uses BONUS AD ratios.   4.9 total ratio counting R's guaranteed crit
Lee Sin: 4.8 AD 


The benefit he receives from AD is comparable to some of the most damage assassins in the game, and unlike a champion such as Pantheon, he possesses a better toolkit for remaining relevant throughout the game.
In fact, the only argument which can be made for him hitting for less than the above mentioned champions, is because of the recent nerf to the base damage of his ultimate which scales at a whopping 2.0.  The only ones in that list above which compare are Rengar, and Pantheon for a SINGLE ability.  Let us not forget the fact that his Q has an 8% missing health damage boost to it.

>I never said how good or not his ratios were. my point was if he goes tank he does 0 damage.

The only champions in the game that maintain relevant damage while building entirely tank were champions such as Ekko and Fizz who had high base damage which was promptly nerfed significantly, in lieu of boosting the AP ratios for their respective abilities.  WHich meant they couldnt be tank ekko and proceed to punch people in the face.




 >and if he builds ad to do relevant damage he's not very tanky. that's a big part of how he's balanced.

This applies to everyone dude.  There are very few champions which can deal relevant damage while being tanky, and they are generally very difficult to land their abilities with such as Sion.
Look, I don't really care for Lee Sin anymore, if Riot believes he is balanced the way he is then they hold the necessary data to prove it.
